Generated Narrative with Details

status: draft

date: 2-Sep 2014 5:51

publisher: HL7 FHIR Standard

group

linkId: Composition

title: A set of resources composed into a single coherent clinical statement with clinical attestation

text: While the focus of this specification is on patient-specific clinical statements, this resource can also apply to other healthcare-related statements such as study protocol designs, healthcare invoices and other activities that are not necessarily patient-specific or clinical.

required: true

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

extension.valueString: A set of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single logical document that provides a single coherent statement of meaning, establishes its own context and that has clinical attestation with regard to who is making the statement.

group.title: A set of resources composed into a single coherent clinical statement with clinical attestation
group.text: While the focus of this specification is on patient-specific clinical statements, this resource can also apply to other healthcare-related statements such as study protocol designs, healthcare invoices and other activities that are not necessarily patient-specific or clinical.

extension.valueString: Logical Identifier for the composition, assigned when created. This identifier stays constant as the composition is changed over time.
The composition editing time, when the composition was last logically changed by the author.
Specifies the particular kind of composition (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note). This usually equates to the purpose of making the composition. null
A categorization for the type of the composition. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the Composition Type. null
Official human-readable label for the composition.
The workflow/clinical status of this composition. The status is a marker for the clinical standing of the document.

group.text: preliminary | final | appended | amended | entered in error

extension.valueString: The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the Composition.

Who or what the composition is about. The composition can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (I.e. machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of livestock, or a set of patients that share a common exposure).

group.text: Who and/or what the composition is about

extension.valueString: Identifies who is responsible for the information in the composition.  (Not necessarily who typed it in.). null

group.text: Who and/or what authored the composition

extension.valueString: A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the composition/document.
The type of attestation the authenticator offers.
When composition was attested by the party. null
Who attested the composition in the specified way. null
Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the composition/document information.
The main event/act/item, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented.

group.title: The clinical event/act/item being documented
group.text: The event needs to be consistent with the type element, though can provide further information if desired.

extension.valueString: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the typeCode, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.

group.text: Code(s) that apply to the event being documented

extension.valueString: The period of time covered by the documentation. There is no assertion that the documentation is a complete representation for this period, only that it documents events during this time. null

group.text: The period covered by the documentation

extension.valueString: Full details for the event(s) the composition/documentation consents. null

question.text: Full details for the event(s) the composition consents

extension.valueString: Describes the clinical encounter or type of care this documentation is associated with. null
The root of the sections that make up the composition.
The heading for this particular section.  This will be part of the rendered content for the document. null
A code identifying the kind of content contained within the section. null
Identifies the primary subject of the section.
Identifies the discrete data that provides the content for the section.

question.text: The actual data for the section

extension.valueString: A nested sub-section within this section.
